evidence.text: This is a civil action alleging that carcinogenic chloroprene emissions from Defendant Denka Performance Elastomer, LLC’s (“Denka’s”) neoprene manufacturing operations at the Pontchartrain Works Site in St. John the Baptist Parish, Louisiana (the “Facility”) present an imminent and substantial endangerment to public health and welfare

extracted.value: imminent and substantial endangerment to public health and welfare due to carcinogenic chloroprene emissions from Denka’s neoprene manufacturing operations

evidence.text: This civil action also seeks relief from DuPont Specialty Products USA, LLC (“DuPont Specialty Products”) based on Fed. R. Civ. P. 19(a) and the All Writs Act, 28 U.S.C. § 1651

extracted.value: failure to obtain consent under the ground lease, requiring cooperation from DuPont for compliance with court orders, based on Fed. R. Civ. P. 19(a) and the All Writs Act

evidence.text: The United States seeks injunctive relief under Clean Air Act Section 303, 42 U.S.C. § 7603

extracted.value: injunctive relief under Clean Air Act Section 303, 42 U.S.C. §7603

evidence.text: This civil action also seeks relief from DuPont Specialty Products USA, LLC (“DuPont Specialty Products”) based on Fed. R. Civ. P. 19(a) and the All Writs Act, 28 U.S.C. § 1651

extracted.value: injunctive relief under Fed. R. Civ. P. 19(a) and the All Writs Act, 28 U.S.C. §1651

evidence.text: The United States seeks injunctive relief under Clean Air Act Section 303, 42 U.S.C. § 7603
This civil action also seeks relief from DuPont Specialty Products USA, LLC (“DuPont Specialty Products”) based on Fed. R. Civ. P. 19(a) and the All Writs Act, 28 U.S.C. § 1651
This civil action also seeks relief from DuPont Specialty Products USA, LLC (“DuPont Specialty Products”) based on Fed. R. Civ. P. 19(a) and the All Writs Act, 28 U.S.C. § 1651
This Court has jurisdiction over the subject matter of this action pursuant to 42 U.S.C. § 7603, and 28 U.S.C. §§ 1331 and 1345
Venue is proper in this District pursuant to 42 U.S.C. § 7603, and 28 U.S.C. § 1391(b) and (c)
